title: Complete Guide to April 2019
body:
Complete Guide to April 2019

Ten years in the making but we’re finally here. Avengers: Endgame premiers this month and while that certainly has us excited its far from the only thing April has to offer.

Movies

Normally I’m not a huge fan of horror movies because while I personally don’t ever get scared of a movie, I also loose the ability to sleep or turn off any of my lights after seeing one. Kicking off on…

summary:
Me @ Myself at 2am:
"Who's on their period right now?"
"Me!"
"Who's in pain right now?"
"Me!"
Me @ Myself at 5 minutes past 2am...
body:
Me @ Myself at 2am:

“Who’s on their period right now?”

“Me!”

“Who’s in pain right now?”

“Me!”

Me @ Myself at 5 minutes past 2am trying to make myself feel better:

“And who’s a badass woman and who isn’t going to complain about it?”

“……….. Carol Danvers?”

reblog.comment:

“……….. Carol Danvers?”

blog.name: thenerdsofcolor
blog.title: The Nerds of Color
blog.description:
We are a community of fans who love superheroes, sci-fi, fantasy and video games but are not afraid to look at nerd/geek fandom with a culturally critical eye.
visit us at http://www.thenerdsofcolor.org

summary: Hard NOC Life: When 'Captain Marvel' Met 'Shazam'
title: Hard NOC Life: When 'Captain Marvel' Met 'Shazam'
body:
New @HardNOCMedia / @DCTVClassics crossover: @the_real_chow & @HiBritneyMonae talk #CaptainMarvel and #Shazam

There are two superhero movies dominating the box office right now, and they both happen to have the same name — well, historically at least. Marvel Studios’ Captain Marvel starring Brie Larson and Warner Bros.’ Shazam! starring Zachary Levi both center around a superhero named Captain Marvel, though neither use that name in their respective movies.

On a recent episode of the DC TV Classicspodcas…

View On WordPress
